submapp.som.Som.weights_features¶

Som.weights_features(features: str, start: int = 0, end: int = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Extract some features from the weights

For each weight k, extracts a feature (only mean and standard deviation are implemented) from weights[k, start:end]

Parameters

  • features (str) – feature to extract, ” mean ” for the mean or ” std ” for the standard deviation

  • start (int, optional) – First row within the weights from which to extract the feature. Can be usefull if each row of the weights represents completely different type of data or if it represents different levels of depth for instance. Defaults to 0

  • end (int, optional) – Last row within the weights from which to extract the feature. Defaults to None, in this case end = p

Return type

np.ndarray[float], shape = (nb_class)
